abstract: Samsung is hoping to capitalize on consumer interest in ever-sleeker displays with a new line of LCD HDTVs that are barely one inch thick.
snippet: Samsung is hoping to capitalize on consumer interest in ever-sleeker displays with a new line of LCD HDTVs that are barely one inch thick.
lead_paragraph: Thin is in — and not just for people. Samsung is hoping to capitalize on consumer interest in ever-sleeker displays with a new line of LCD HDTVs that are barely one inch thick.

headline.main: Samsung Uses LEDs for a Thinner HD Television
headline.print_headline: A Peek at Some of What's Coming to an Electronics Store Near You: A High-Definition TV Display That’s Just an Inch Thick

abstract: Seagate’s FreeAgent Theater HD media player taps into a portable hard drive to put video, photos and music on a television set.
snippet: Seagate’s FreeAgent Theater HD media player taps into a portable hard drive to put video, photos and music on a television set.
lead_paragraph: For years now, electronics makers have been chasing the chimera of a storage device that can easily — the operative word here — retrieve music, videos and photos from a hard drive and send them to a television as well as a PC.

headline.main: Player That Reaches Into a Hard Drive and Pulls Out Media
headline.print_headline: A Peek at Some of What's Coming to an Electronics Store Near You: Making It Look Easy, a Player Reaches Into a Hard Drive And Pulls Out Media for the Television Screen
